content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the Julia code to solve this problem:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[\s-]+" => "_")
end
```
This function works by first converting the column name to lower case and then stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces. It then replaces all spaces and hyphens with underscores using the `replace` function. The regular expression `r"[\s-]+"` matches one or more whitespace characters (spaces, tabs, newlines) or hyphens.
